comments.body:
I support cave fish! I think a blind cave tetra or other cave-specific fish would be more appropriate. Catfish and snakehead seem like a river/swamp/lake fish, sturgeon river/lake, and flounder are definitely ocean fish.

Like garry Leonard's comment in this post - https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360046521592-Cave-Fish

Or another post on cave tetras - https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360073472031-Blind-cave-tetras-for-the-new-caves

I know that snakeheads and sturgeons and flounders don't actually live in caves. The azalea tree doesn't actually grow in caves, though, and domestic cows don't live in the wild. there is also (thankfully) a distinct lack of wild boars in the overworld of Minecraft.

I would support them adding these fish to their respective habitats, but I also think the caves need more life (and the axolotls need friends [and food])
Such a good idea! It would be stupid to see a witch in a lush a cave, or even a zombie!
Jolly good post! Right crackin'!
Maybe mobs wouldnâ€™t spawn in the deep dark because the warden would kill them because of their vibrations.
I feel like creepers spawning more frequently in lush caves would make more sense since they're kind of plant-y, but a neat idea nonetheless!
Maybe name tags too? Saddles? I agree that they need a revamp.
Leatherworkers should definitely sell leads!
Maybe they should spawn in lush caves.

yes i love this idea please add this.
but have it so if we cover it in wax it does not rust

They could also cause the iron golems to rust if they are in contact with water and we have to remove the rust with the ax and that the more rusty this less damage it would do and it would have less life, in addition to being able to wax it.
Dying the armor should make it glow different colors.
I think it should only be applied to leather armor

As spider attacks mainly consist of jumping, jumping from walls and ceilings should increase the damage they cause. It should also be used to get to players if the ground does not work. Spider Jockeys may do this so the Skeletons can aim better
Maybe only on Hard, or even a new difficulty.
Great idea because spiders are kind of boring to fight currently.
Pretty good idea! Just not enough votes to make to the big leagues...

I was thinking of something very similar. And if it was possible for a dog whistle to have multiple functions, (a) sit all your dogs within a defined radius, (b) stand all your sitting dogs within a certain radius, and (c) recall your attacking or wandering dogs to your side without sitting them.

This is a clever idea! I'm a little worried it might make it too easy to farm enchantments, so it should probably cost a lot of amethyst to do, and amethyst should have other uses as well so you have to decide what you want to use your amethyst for. However, this is one of the best ideas I've seen about what to do with amethyst, so I am all for this! Vote for yourself, because this is good.
Yes. Axolotls should be hostile to them. Maybe chickens too?

Great idea! I love your idea about adding worms and glowworms to minecraft. It would really bring som e colour and movement to the game. And great idea you have to use them in composters. And feed them to axolotls, because they eat worms IRL.

What about using them as bait when you fish? To increase chance of getting fish instead of junk.

but what do glow worms do? maybe make the axolotl glow.
Yess this would be amazing the glow ones should be in dark caves and normal ones in da floor
how about ice crystals (like amethyst crystals, but they are ice)

How about powder snow traps, lots of stray spawns, ice only caves and icicles. The ice caves should have sapphires. The ice caves would be the only cave biome that would have sapphires. The sapphires would mostly spawn in the actual caves than in the cave walls (in stone). This would make it more benefitial to go threw the caves.

Sapphire would be a new currency that you can trade with new mining villagers and also with new cave mobs like a ghost miner or goblin to get some new unique and rare items. Sapphires can also be used to upgrade tools and armor to work better underwater. Finally they can be used with a new alchemy table (magical crafting table found in excavation sites) to create new different enchantments.
I would LOVE to explore something like that
Neat
Bruh, Mojang Studios doesn't want the warden to be killed
Diamond helmet only
Diamond helmet only

Maybe if they had something like a Custom World Generation world type where you can adjust the probable height of mountains, depth of oceans, size of caves, variety of biomes, etc., while also have the option to use presets. Maybe they could even change the world type system completely to be more customizable from one place. You could enable certain things such as "Classic Style" for biomes, structures, and generation, and even change the properties of other dimensions.
I love this idea I think more customization is needed

This is a great idea, one that I was going to suggest until I saw you posted it, especially since 1.18 was releases I wanted this to be a feature, cause although the new gen looks amazing, I still like the old gen more and wish that either this was a feature, or the mountains and caves were rarer.

lol thats going to make the warden too eisey i think it should have four levels can't be found in enywhere but the warden tavern each level will negate 1 block from it so the warden can hear you from 4 blocks away (not just negates it entrely)

and it should be called muting

This wonâ€™t be added as they said multiple time that the warden is NOT meant to be attacked. Itâ€™s meant to be an obstacle. NOT a goal. Youâ€™re supposed to sneak around it. Not attack it. It also would completely ruin the idea of sneaking past it.
Leather boots already prevent sinking in to powdered snow.
Completely agree and it was intriguing when you went into this sleepy cave and awoke the evil sculk
I totally agree. It doesn't look like a plant anymore but rather a tentacle. Eeek.
concrete and wool should also glow
This fits the Caves and Cliffs update so much!

I like this idea because it's all-encompassing with the various posts asking for individual items to glow.  Anything you can use dye on can also get GLOWING DYE (armor, beds, banners, signs, shields, etc).

The debate is on for making glowing glass, concrete, wool, sheep (kinda want a glowing sheep now - GLOWING JEB!), and such.

Love it. My idea was same just was going to describe as making florescent dyes. The only concern is the lag it might introduce if everything sparkles. I'd prefer to just make the bright colors if it causes much lag. Suppose a setting to turn sparkle on/off would be good.

The freezing effect should only appear during a snowstorm, not regular snowfall.
To prevent this, you must wear full leather armor, stand within 3 blocks of the campfire (or fire), or be in a shelter.
Additionally, Zombies in leather armor should appear more frequently during snowstorms, and Villagers in snow biomes who wear winter clothes should be immune to the freeze effect.

This could be exclusive to hard difficulty. Freezing from snowstroms will be slower than powder snow, but you must use full leather armor or stand near a heat source (fire, campfires, lava, etc) to avoid dying.
I don't really like the idea of dinosaur eggs and heads. Perhaps they sell skeleton and zombie heads?
Archaeologist Villagers could spawn around excavation sites
I SO WANT PET DINO
love idea
I put this under caves and cliffs because there would also be waterfalls and the glaciers would be on top of mountains.
While fishing out gold would be cool, I also think it would be interesting if there were gold ores generated around it. You could use bowls to pan for gold similar to archaeology
Nice idea, but you know that villagers don't live on mountains, which is why only in the mountains can you find emeralds underground
I wrote a post about a special villager who lives in the mountains, I suggest you read my post
The wind chimes should need amethyst to craft because amethysts already sound like chimes, and amethyst needs more recipes.

I agree w/ @beefster82, there's another wind-chime post I commented on that I think is a little better but I really like the divining chime maybe using a compass and a redstone dust added to an amethyst wind chime.
If be nice to see diviners for various resources.

The recipe for a chime should involve more like 3 of the variant specific resource like amethyst, Copper, bamboo chutes, & maybe glass, or other varieties. Then 2 string, a pressure plate ( iron or wood variants) then either a chain on top or 3 iron or gold nuggets on the top.
For example:

I would benice to have Obsidian & Nautilus shell chimes too...coral chimes it be so neat to be able to add individual arrangement of the chimes with their own sound... oh the possibilities...
bruh thats already a thing
putting them in water or putting them near/in sea/ocean biome should accelerate them

I'm so glad I'm not the only one who noticed this. If they really wanna have calcite it could be put inside the geode because sometimes calcite forms inside amethyst geodes. Not all geodes should have it though, maybe it can have a rare chance to appear inside the geodes. I don't know what other stones are the outer layers of amethyst geodes besides basalt as I'm just a gemstone hobbyist but tuff definitely doesn't seem right. Really hope they don't not want to change these to those just because there's quartz and basalt in the nether already.
somewhat accurate ingame geology would be amazing, I hope they listen to the scientist on this one

This game isn't meant to represent realistic chemistry or geology. Like honestly, this is an update that introduces a fungus which reacts to sound to produce energy and a blind fungus monster with trapped souls in it's chest, and you think this is the unrealistic part?. I really don't think this is that big of a deal. If you really want to just get a resource pack to change the name of calcite to "quarzite" and tuff to "rock" or something. There's no need to introduce any kind of chemical explanation in the actual game as to why ores and minerals spawn where they spawn.

I think that having a biome of emeralds is way overpowered, even if its a 1/10000 chance to generate. a more balanced idea is a very rare cave biome that generates more emerald ore than extreme hills, maybe 3/100 chance of generating, or less, and it would generate 2-3 emerald ore, or more per chunk.
Yes I had a same idea! Because it is very rare to find it normally!
Maybe there could be emerald blocks?
